wikipedia_page.main: Charles Richard Thomson (2 March 1930 – 6 January 2009), also known as Chic Thomson, was a Scottish football goalkeeper. After playing for Clyde he won the 1954–55 Football League with Chelsea and the 1959 FA Cup Final with Nottingham Forest.

response: *Charlie Thomson, Clyde, Chelsea and Nottingham Forest goalkeeper (1949–61), retired to Sandiacre.
Some 48 players have left Blairgowrie to become Senior footballers, and they include Charlie Thomson, Kenny Cameron, and Lindsay Kydd to name a few.
Charles or Charlie Thomson may also refer to:
* Charlie Thomson (1930–2009), Scottish football goalkeeper who played for Clyde, Chelsea and Nottingham Forest
* Charlie Thomson (footballer, born 1905) (1905–1965), father of the above, Scottish football goalkeeper who played for Falkirk, Brighton & Hove Albion and others

*6 January 2009 – Charlie Thomson, 78, former goalkeeper who played for Chelsea and Nottingham Forest. Won the league with Chelsea in 1954–55, and the FA Cup with Forest in 1959.Forest legend Thomson passes away BBC Sport. Retrieved on 7 January 2009.
*Charlie Thomson, 78, Scottish footballer (Clyde, Chelsea, Nottingham Forest).
